domains.name: Blockchain
domains.description: Explores decentralized technologies, smart contracts, and blockchain applications.

events.name: Crypto Countdown: Final Block of 2024
events.description: Crypto Countdown was a two-day online seminar covering blockchain fundamentals, decentralized finance (DeFi), smart contracts, and the future of Web3. Industry experts provided insights into blockchain's impact on business and security.

domains.name: Competitive Programming
domains.description: Focuses on problem-solving, algorithms, and competitive programming challenges.

events.name: Output Unveiled
events.description: Output Unveiled was an intense coding contest where participants solved 16 programming challenges in C and C++, unlocking each level with the output of the previous question. It tested logical thinking, debugging, and problem-solving skills.

events.name: PyMind
events.description: PyMind was an engaging Python-based quiz competition for first-year students. Covering basic to advanced Python topics, the quiz provided a competitive yet supportive environment to test and enhance programming skills.

events.name: Master The Code
events.description: A timed coding competition with algorithmic challenges to test participants' problem-solving skills and coding speed.

domains.name: Cloud Computing

events.description: To educate students on the cloud computing and strengthen their ability in cloud through an interactive.

domains.name: Cybersecurity
domains.description: Focuses on ethical hacking, cryptography, and securing applications.

events.name: Cyber Hive
events.description: Cyber Hive was an interactive seminar focused on cybersecurity awareness, scam prevention, and career opportunities in cybersecurity and networking. It featured live demonstrations of security threats and best practices for digital safety.

events.name: Catch The Phish
events.description: To educate students on the dangers of phishing attacks and strengthen their ability to recognize and mitigate cyber threats through an interactive and engaging competition.

events.name: Decode the World of Cybersecurity
events.description: To educate students on Bug Bounties, CTFs, and strengthen their ability in Cybersecurity through an interactive and engaging competition.

events.name: GET GIT GO – Master Version Control
events.description: A structured, practical workshop on Git and GitHub, including real-world applications and best practices.

events.name: UI Forge
events.description: We'll give a prompt to everyone to implement, and after completing it we'll conduct voting. The one who gets the most votes for the best implementation will be the winner.

domains.name: Club Activities
domains.description: Fun, engaging, and community-building events organized under AsCI to boost creativity, collaboration, and technical enthusiasm.

events.name: Tech_Quiz
events.description: The Online Quiz Contest held during the inauguration of the Association of Computer Intellects (AsCI) was a highly engaging and informative event. Designed to test participants' knowledge of computer science and technology.

events.name: LOLgorithms
events.description: LOLgorithms was a unique meme-making contest where students used humor to explain technical concepts related to algorithms and computer science.

events.name: Skill Over Knowledge – Thriving in the AI Era
events.description: The event highlighted the growing importance of hands-on skills over theoretical knowledge in today’s education system.

events.name: Android Dev Sprint
events.description: A hands-on workshop aimed at introducing 1st and 2nd-year students to the fundamentals of Android development.

events.name: Byte the Byte
events.description: A two-day workshop conducted on Linux Commands, GitHub, and Programming Language.
